problem: What is the smallest positive multiple of $13$ that is greater than $500?$
solution: Dividing $500$ by $13$ gives a quotient $38$ with a remainder of $6$. In other words, \[500 \div 13=13 \cdot 38+6.\]So, the smallest positive multiple of $13$ that is greater than $500$ is \[13\cdot39=\boxed{507}.\]
